DISCIPLE stepped back from TUCSON, although there is no fear in his
face nor his demeanor, but it is a gesture of respect.

"Ahh yes, old one I still see you in there." There is a nod from
DISCIPLE. "Tucson, if indeed there is anything left of the old dragon
within you then he would recognize me."

And indeed there is sense of grudging trust from the remnants of the
ancient dragon within TUCSON although TUCSON could choose to ignore it
if he liked.

"I have come not to challenge you within your rookery." DISCIPLE said.
"But Arcane, the most ancient of all dragons living would cast his
eyes on the one to whom the old one has committed his A'ja."

TUSCSON may get the jist of that last word A'ja from his connection to
the old one, it is ancient draconic for dragon's breath. However not
as a mode of attack. The dragons felt that their power and even their
life came from their breath, and when they died and took their last
breath, their A'ja was set free.

(TAG)

- Preston
